Tambang Bukit di Perum Abdi Negara Kota Tasikmalaya Dihentikan
05 Nov 2019, 10:46 by Bambang Arifianto
TASIKMALAYA, (PR).- Dinas Energi Dan Sumber Daya Mineral Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Barat menghentikan aktivitas penambangan bukit di kawasan Perumahan Abdi Negara, Kelurahan/Kecamatan Mangkubumi, Kota Tasikmalaya. Praktik penambangan tersebut diduga dilakukan dengan dalih reklamasi dan penanggulangan bencana longsor.
Keputusan tersebut diungkapkan Kepala Seksi Pertambangan dan Air Tanah Dinas ESDM Cabdin Wilayah VI Tasikmalaya Yogi Galva dalam rapat pembahasan di Kantor Dinas Energi Dan Sumber Daya Mineral Cabdin Wilayah VI Tasikmalaya di Jalan Perintis Kemerdekaan KM 5, Kota Tasikmalaya, ‎Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Yogi meminta alat-alat berat untuk mengeruk dan mengangkut hasil tambang keluar dari area tersebut. Keputusan itu diambil setelah Yogi mendengarkan pemaparan dari BPBD, Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Kota Tasikmalaya, Polsek Mangkubumi serta pemilik tanah dan pelaku usaha tambang dalam rapat itu.
Hasilnya, praktik penambangan tersebut diketahui tak memiliki izin serta dalih reklamasi dan penanggulangan longsor justru tak sesuai aturan yang berlaku. "Kita kan sudah konfirmasi tadi ke BPBD ke LH bahwa itu tidak, bukan kategori reklamasi yang sebagaimana dimaksud di Undang Undang (No) 4/2009," ucapnya. Dalih pelaku penambangan terkait kegiatannya mengeruk bukit adalah bagian dari reklamasi dan penanggulangan bencana tak bisa diterima lantaran tak memiliki izin usaha pertambangan. Kegiatan reklamasi, tutur Yogi, mestinya didahului oleh mendapatkan izin tersebut. 
Hasil rapat itu mempertegas bahwa pengerukan bukit merupakan aktivitas penambangan bukan reklamasi dan penanggulangan longsor sebagaimana yang dikemukakan oleh pelaku penggalian. "Dengan tidak adanya izin usaha pertambangan dipersilahkan untukk urus izinnya dan hentikan kegiatannya sebelum dapat izin, wajar kan sesuai aturan itu," ucap Yogi. 
Dalih reklamasi, tambang sempat diteruskan
Kasus tersebut mengemuka saat petugas ESDM melakukan pembinaan serta pengawasan di lokasi tersebut. "Ternyata di lapangan menemukan itu, kalau tidak berizin biasanya kita kasih surat," ujarnya. Surat teguran bahkan telah dilayangkan beberapa kali. "Sudah dua kali (mengirimkan surat) dan yang ketiga mereka berdalih bahwa ini reklamasi dan penanggulangan bahaya longsor," ujarnya. 
Hal senada dilontarkan Kepala Bidang Kajian Lingkungan Hidup dan Konservasi Sumber Daya Alam Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Kota Tasikmalaya Didin Syaripudin. Didin memastikan penambangan di bukit yang juga berlokasi di belakang Hotel Mangkubumi tersebut belum memiliki izin.
Klaim reklamasi pun mentah lantaran upaya pemulihan lahan di bukit yang sempat longsor itu mesti berupa jaminan kepada Pemprov Jabar selepas penambang memperoleh izin. Persoalannya, bagaimana mungkin reklamasi dilakukan sedangkan izin penambangnya pun tak dimiliki. "Kalau sekarag mah kan harus ada jaminan, jaminan reklamasi (dari) provinsi," tuturnya.
Dalam dokumen surat antara pelaku penambangan, pemilik lahan dan Dinas ESDM Cabdin Wilayah VI Tasikmalaya terungkap pelaku pengerukan dan pengerukan pasir itu adalah CV Yudisyrazz. Sedangkan pemilik lahan bukit bernama Wahyu Tri Rahmadi. Wahyu memberikan kuasa kepada Tjahja Wandawa untuk mewakilinya. Dalam rapat tersebut, Tjahja yang merupakan anggota DPRD Kota Tasikmalaya itu juga hadir. Tjahja tak mempersoalkan jika memang penambangan di lahan Wahyu bakal ditutup.
"Kalau boleh dihentikan, hari ini dihentikan," kata Tjahja saat rapat berlangsung. Meski demikian, jika opsi beroperasi tetap perlu izin, ia pun meminta hal tersebut disampaikan di dalam rapat. Tjahja mengaku sempat menyetop penggalian itu. Namun sejumlah ketua RT meminta aktivitas dilakukan dengan alasan untuk reklamasi dan penataan lahan agar warga terhindar dari bencana dan longsor di musim hujan. 
Keputusan penghentian juga tak bisa diterima oleh sejumlah perwakilan pelaku usaha penambangan bukit di Perumahan Abdi Negara tersebut. Mereka mempersoalkan aspek keadilan lantaran beberapa kawasan tambang lain belum tersentuh penegakkan aturan. Permasalahan potensi konflik lantaran penghentian aktivitas penambangan turut dikemukakan. Yogi tetap bersikukuh dan mempersilahkan pelaku usaha tambang tersebut menempuh jalur hukum melalui pengadilan. Suasana rapat sempat berlangsung panas. Tekanan nada suara tinggi dan saling bantah mewarnai jalannya rapat.
"PR" mencoba menelusuri kawasan penambangan itu selepas rapat selesai. Bukit yang dikeruk memang berada di dekat perumahan. Kendati keputusan penghentian telah dilakukan, aktivitas penambangan tetap berlangsung.***

The Bukit Mine in the State Abdi Tasikmalaya State Corporation was stopped
05 Nov 2019, 10:46 by Bambang Arifianto
TASIKMALAYA, (PR) .- The Department of Energy and Mineral Resources of the West Java Provincial Government has stopped the activities of hill mining in the Abdi Negara housing area, Kelurahan / Mangkubumi District, Tasikmalaya City. The mining practice was allegedly carried out on the pretext of reclamation and disaster management.
The decision was revealed by the Head of the Mining and Groundwater Section of the ESDM Cabdin Region VI Tasikmalaya Office Yogi Galva during a discussion meeting at the Cabdin Regional Energy and Mineral Resources Department Office Tasikmalaya on Jalan Perintis Kemerdekaan KM 5, Tasikmalaya City, Tuesday, 5 November 2019.
Yogi asked heavy equipment to dredge and transport mining products out of the area. The decision was taken after Yogi listened to the presentation from the BPBD, the Tasikmalaya City Environmental Agency, Mangkubumi Sector Police as well as the land owners and mining businesses in the meeting.
As a result, the mining practice is known to not have a permit and the pretext of reclamation and landslide management is not in accordance with applicable regulations. "We have confirmed earlier to the BPBD to LH that it was not, not the reclamation category as referred to in Law (No) 4/2009," he said. The excuse of mining operators regarding their activities to dredge hills is part of reclamation and disaster management is unacceptable because they do not have a mining business permit. Reclamation activities, said Yogi, should have been preceded by obtaining the permit.
The results of the meeting emphasized that hill dredging is a mining activity not a reclamation and landslide prevention as stated by the excavators. "In the absence of a mining business permit, you are welcome to take care of the permit and stop the activity before you get the permit, it is natural according to the rules," Yogi said.
Under the pretext of reclamation, the mine was continued
The case surfaced when ESDM officers conducted guidance and supervision at the location. "It turns out that in the field we find that, if not licensed we usually give a letter," he said. Letters of reprimand have even been posted several times. "It has been twice (sent letters) and the third one is that they claim that this is the reclamation and mitigation of landslides," he said.
The same thing was said by the Head of Environmental Studies and Natural Resources Conservation Division of the Tasikmalaya City Environmental Office, Didin Syaripudin. Didin ensured that mining on the hill which is also located behind the Mangkubumi Hotel does not yet have a permit.
The reclamation claim was also raw because the land restoration effort on the hill which had experienced a landslide must be a guarantee to the West Java Provincial Government after the miner obtained a permit. The problem is, how can reclamation be carried out while the mining permit is not owned. "Now, there must be guarantees, reclamation guarantees (from) the provinces," he said.
In a document between the mining agent, land owner and ESDM Cabdin Region VI Tasikmalaya, it was revealed that the perpetrator of the sand dredging and dredging was CV Yudisyrazz. While the owner of the hill land named Wahyu Tri Rahmadi. Wahyu gave power to Tjahja Wandawa to represent him. During the meeting, Tjahja who was a member of the Tasikmalaya City DPRD was also present. Tjahja did not question if mining in Wahyu's land would be closed.
"If it can be stopped, today is stopped," said Tjahja during the meeting. However, if the operating option still needs a permit, he also requested that it be conveyed in the meeting. Tjahja claimed to have stopped the excavation. However, a number of RT chiefs requested that the activities be carried out on the grounds of reclamation and land arrangement so that residents would avoid disaster and landslides in the rainy season.
The decision to terminate also cannot be accepted by a number of representatives of hill mining business actors in the Abdi Negara Housing. They questioned the aspect of justice because several other mining areas had not been touched by the enforcement of the rules. Problems with the potential for conflict due to the cessation of mining activities were also raised. Yogi remained adamant and invited the mining business actors to take legal action through the court. The atmosphere of the meeting was hot. High tonal pressure and mutual arguments color the course of the meeting.
"PR" tries to trace the mining area after the meeting is over. The dredged hill is indeed near the housing estate. Despite the decision to stop it, mining activities continue. ***
